reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Prepositioning of Emergency NFIs for Designated Emergency Shelters and for Host-community Emergency Responses

description.narrative: The project supports for enhanced preparations for possible future escalations in hostilities through the prepositioning and warehousing of the lifesaving NFIs. This project fits with Strategic Objective (3) of shelter and NFIs cluster “Capacity to respond to natural or manmade hazards in a timely, efficient and effective manner is increased “. On other hand, the action is in line with the assigned objective of allocation strategy “The prepositioning of stocks and provision of other of soft/consumable components for Designated Emergency Shelters and for host-community emergency responses". The project includes to replenish MA'AN existing stockpiles with NFIs to ensure responsive and accountable emergency response. This has been considering the NFI standard packages and kits of Shelter cluster that were designed to meet the gender and protection needs. Five partner CBOs will be engaged in the stockpiling intervention. The project should support to enhance the capacity of MA'AN and the five partner CBOs to apply more efficient stockpiling management protocols while providing for more inclusive and gender sensitive emergency response actions. Set of hosting communities will be targeted in Gaza City and the Northern Governorate including Southern Rimal, Beach Camp, Sheikh Radwan, Al Nasser Area, Jabalia Al Nazleh, and Western Zaitoon Area. As a result of the proposed actions total individuals of 9,353 including 2520 women, 2580 men, 2101 girls, and 2152 boys will have access to their needs of shelter NFIs at the onset of an emergency. The project applies community-based preparedness and emergency response mechanisms. MA’AN capitalizes on its community-based emergency response structure to support the IDPs in hosting communities and others in the PA-Led designated emergency shelters to access their needs of life saving NFIs. The NFIs stockpiles will serve mainly the hosting communities in emergencies and will be ready as a backup to support the IDPs of the governmental designated shelters. The project builds on MA'AN experience in stockpiling and emergency distribution of NFIs in coordination with the shelter cluster and the national emergency response structures.
